intro: Erigeron filiformis, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It features slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron filiformis is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
